directions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in heavy medium skillet over medium heat. Add all bell peppers and sauté until tender, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add garlic, rosemary, coriander, fennel, pepper, thyme, bay leaf and remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil. Simmer mixture 5 minutes to blend flavors. Remove from heat. Season to taste with salt. Cool to room temperature.
Arrange goat cheese on platter. Spoon dressing over. Let stand at room temperature 1 hour. Sprinkle with pine nuts and serve with baguette slices.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary or 3/4 teaspoon dried
8 ounces chilled goat cheese (such as Montrachet), cut into 8 slices
title: Goat Cheese with Bell Pepper Dressing
